attributes.action: Provide asylum for Iraqis who worked on reconstruction for Coalition forces and who in consequence are at risk of murder
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Iraqi citizens who have worked for the Coalition during its period of existence are at risk of execution by insurgents, or at minimum, of kidnapping by kidnap gangs who associate employment with wealth. These circumstances have arisen during the UK and US occupation for which we have obligations under international law; however it is arguable that these Iraqi citizens have, intentionally or not, worked toward the national security interests of the UK and through the lack of security for which are at least partly responsible, their lives are at risk.

It is in our interests as a country that defends its allies and has a well defined humanitarian conscience, that we consider all applications for asylum from Iraqi employees of the Coalition that might seek asylum in the U.K.
